author: markekraus
body:
While looking at the current tests Export-Csv I found the following issues:

-----
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f604b0e3f063c7a89db025f11b320e5c9797c6e0/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Export-Csv.Tests.ps1#L14
Should use `ShouldBeErrorId` and test for a proper FQEID

-----
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f604b0e3f063c7a89db025f11b320e5c9797c6e0/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Export-Csv.Tests.ps1#L22
Should be `Should Be` and a full srting instead of partial match since this is static.

-----
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f604b0e3f063c7a89db025f11b320e5c9797c6e0/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Export-Csv.Tests.ps1#L48
Should be `epcsv` here to test the alias.

-----
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f604b0e3f063c7a89db025f11b320e5c9797c6e0/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Export-Csv.Tests.ps1#L69-L70
should be wrapped in a `BeforeAll{}`

-----

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/f604b0e3f063c7a89db025f11b320e5c9797c6e0/test/powershell/Modules/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Export-Csv.Tests.ps1#L64
This can be removed because the `$TestDrive` will clean up after itself.

comments.body: @marusyk I am assigning this issue to myself to prevent duplication of effort.

comments.author: Marusyk
comments.body: @markekraus But why did you remove Hacktoberfest label? This is not fair. What's the problem of just leaving a comment to prevent duplication of effort?

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @Marusyk I removed it to prevent it from showing up for people looking for hacktoberfest issue to to work on. It wont go against your hacktoberfest counts. But I have added it back.
